entry.title: The Unified Commerce Mandate: Leveraging SAP Technology to Achieve the 89% Retention Advantage
entry.content:
The era of multi-channel is over. Today's successful businesses rely on a connected SAP Intelligent Enterprise to eliminate friction and drive superior customer lifetime value (CLV).

 

Introduction: The Shift from Silo to System

The term "omni-channel" has long been synonymous with digital ambition, but its true significance has evolved. It is no longer a future-state strategy; it is a fundamental requirement of the Experience Economy. When a modern consumer engages with a brand, they expect a single, continuous conversation, regardless of whether the touchpoint is digital, physical, or voice.

This expectation is directly tied to business outcomes:

  • Customer Loyalty: Research indicates that enterprises with mature omni-channel engagement strategies achieve nearly 89% higher year-over-year customer retention rates compared to those with weak strategies. This loyalty directly translates to a 30% higher customer lifetime value (CLV).

  • Revenue Generation: Campaign performance also reflects this cohesion, with multi-channel campaigns resulting in a purchase rate increase of up to 287%. Furthermore, even traditional retail benefits, as digital omni-channel activity drives an approximate 80% increase in incremental visits to physical store locations.

The challenge, therefore, is structural: how do organisations consolidate disparate customer engagement systems and transactional data into one unified commerce platform?

The Solution Architecture: A Blueprint for Unified Commerce

Achieving this level of consistency requires a robust, scalable architecture that places the customer at the centre, integrating front-end engagement with back-end operations. This is the sweet spot of the SAP Intelligent Enterprise.

A. The Engagement Hub: SAP Commerce Cloud

SAP Commerce Cloud serves as the agile, API-first foundation for customer interaction. Its core strength is the ability to decouple the commerce engine from any single front-end presentation.

  • Headless Flexibility: This architecture allows businesses to quickly deploy commerce services to emerging channels (social, IoT, in-store screens) while ensuring that catalog, inventory, and pricing data remain consistent and centrally managed.

  • Fulfilment Optimisation: It is essential for enabling complex but critical omni-channel services such as Buy Online, Pick Up In-Store (BOPIS) and Ship-from-Store, which demand real-time synchronisation with logistics.

B. The Foundational Core: SAP Business Suite

Flawless omni-channel execution rests on accurate back-office data. SAP S/4HANA (the central pillar of the SAP Business Suite) provides the real-time, consolidated transactional system necessary for this execution.

  • By unifying financial, inventory, and supply chain data, S/4HANA guarantees that the inventory status shown to the customer on Commerce Cloud is instantly reflected across the enterprise, eliminating costly discrepancies and service failures.

C. The Integration & Extension Layer: SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP)

The SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) is the critical middleware that eliminates data silos between the Commerce Cloud and the SAP S/4HANA core.

  • Integration Suite: Facilitates rapid, pre-built integration between SAP and non-SAP systems, ensuring a holistic flow of customer and order data.

  • Extensibility: BTP allows for the creation of custom applications (e.g., a bespoke in-store client for associates) that access unified data without disrupting the core business systems.

D. The Intelligence Engine: SAP AI Capabilities

To move beyond consistent service to truly contextual and predictive customer experiences, Artificial Intelligence (AI) is indispensable. SAP embeds AI across its portfolio:

  • SAP CX AI Toolkit: This powers personalisation through solutions like SAP Emarsys, enabling real-time product recommendations, personalised journeys, and optimised content based on unified customer data.

  • Intelligent Automation: SAP AI capabilities in the broader business suite enable predictive inventory management and automated demand forecasting, ensuring that the right product is in the right location to fulfil the promise made by the Commerce Cloud.

Conclusion

The mandate is clear: the market rewards unified, intelligent customer experiences. By leveraging SAP Commerce Cloud, SAP BTP, and the integrated power of SAP Business Suite and its AI capabilities, organisations can move beyond simply managing multiple channels to truly operating as an Intelligent Omni-Channel Enterprise, securing that vital customer loyalty and market growth.

SAP Commerce Cloud SAP HANA Enterprise Cloud SAP BTP, Kyma runtime SAP Commerce #S4HANA #SAPBTP SAP Business Suite #IntelligentEnterprise #CXAIToolkit #AI #BusinessAI Artificial Intelligence

entry.title: How Redwood Software and SAP are shaping the next era of automation with Joule Studio
entry.content:
Introduction

Over the past year, Redwood Software has taken major steps forward in our long-standing partnership with SAP, turning the vision of conversational, agentic automation into something you can see and use today.

As Field CTO at Redwood, Iâ€™ve spent many years helping SAP customers orchestrate their most critical workloads. Our shared mission with SAP has always been clear: make complex processes simpler, more reliable and, ultimately, autonomous.

Embedding automation into conversation with Joule Studio

In my previous post, I introduced how RunMyJobs by Redwood connects with SAP Joule Studio to transform automation into natural conversation. Since then, weâ€™ve built a tech preview that demonstrates a use case for how RunMyJobsâ€™ interoperability with SAP Joule makes agentic orchestration a reality you can scale for your most mission-critical processes.

One example is an autonomous, unplanned SAP system maintenance workflow. Traditionally, this requires multiple manual steps and cross-team coordination to pause background jobs, stop dependent integrations and verify dependencies. The SAP BTP team often has to schedule, stop or undeploy iFlows ad hoc, while the Basis team handles job suspension separately. Thus, itâ€™s a fragmented process filled with stress and risk.

Today, an SAP Basis administrator can take a more goal-oriented approach. They can simply tell Joule what they need to do: 

â€œSafely execute the SAP system maintenance procedure, including a pause on all dependent workflows associated with the system to avoid job failures.â€

Joule triggers the complete, pre-approved workflow across RunMyJobs and the relevant SAP systems. Acting as an interactive control tower for the entire event, it executes pre-approved RunMyJobs workflows, coordinates with integrations and provides real-time progress and approval updates through natural language with either business or IT users.

For example, Joule might respond: 

â€œAll background jobs are paused, and Integration Suite iFlows are offline. Do you approve the system restart now, or do you want to send an approval request to the system administrator for a restart?â€ 

Once the administrator confirms, the automated workflow proceeds to the next step.

ğŸ‘‰See Joule in action with RunMyJobs here:

 

What we learned building Joule skills

Working with Joule Studioâ€™s low-code design canvas confirmed how quickly governed automation can be delivered through conversational interfaces. Our approach focused on four essentials:

  1. Natural conversation design: Translating how SAP users actually phrase requests into machine-understandable prompts
  2. Action orchestration: Linking RunMyJobs APIs or pre-built SAP Accelerator Hub actions for pausing jobs, managing iFlows and performing restarts safely
  3. Context and safeguards: Supplying metadata so Joule executes only on the right systems, with test harnesses for edge cases
  4. Governed deployment: Leveraging accelerated compliance checks provided by RunMyJobsâ€™ SAP Endorsed App Premium certification to reliably execute controlled deployment across SAP environments

How RunMyJobs and Joule Studio connect

The integration between RunMyJobs and Joule Studio allows your teams to innovate safely across SAP environments and in various scenarios. The process looks like this:

  1. Publish operations in RunMyJobs, such as starting or pausing jobs.
  2. Publish actions to the SAP Business Accelerator Hub, making them available as reusable building blocks. 
  3. Secure access through SAP BTP using API keys and role-based permissions. You then govern access to these operations within the SAP BTP Cockpit. 
  4. Combine these actions in Joule Studio to build skills that connect automation with natural language requests.

This framework lets IT and business teams interact with automation directly in their workflow tools, so itâ€™s governed, auditable and ready for expansion.

The future of automation is a conversation

We are only at the starting line of whatâ€™s possible. The combination of RunMyJobs and SAP Joule is laying the foundation for agentic automation across finance, supply chain, HR, IT and beyond. As SAP continues to advance its Business AI capabilities, Redwood will keep embedding orchestration where it matters most: within the business conversation.

Learn more about how Redwood works with SAP solutions.

entry.title: The Next Generation SAP Enterprise Architect Learning Forum - February 23â€“26, 2026 at Newtown Sq. PA
entry.content:
If there is one event that every Enterprise Architect in the SAP ecosystem could choose to join, this should be the one.The Next Generation SAP Enterprise Architect Learning Forum 2026 is a 3.5-day multitrack conference hosted at SAP Americas' Newtown Square campus, Staring deep-dive pre-conference workshops on February 23, followed by three full days of agenda-driven sessions from February 24â€“27.

The learning forum is meant for SAP EAs to understanding current and emerging topics like transformation,  AI,  Evolution of Agents, Data Architecture, SAP Business Data Cloud,  and the Human Edge for expanding strategic influence of an Enterprise Architect.

Structured as a professional learning forum rather than a keynote-only event, it is designed to advance architectural mastery while strengthening the community shaping the future of SAP Enterprise Architecture.

You can mark your calendars already for the 2026 agenda while the registration is opening in the next 2 weeks.

You will have opportunity to join your peers, SAP experts, and industry thought leaders for four days of deep learning, hands-on sessions, and collaboration around the evolving role of the SAP Enterprise Architect.

This is a learning forum designed for Enterprise Architects, by Enterprise Architects. 

While we open the registrations for your to sign up, you can check out the following resources to give you an idea of the amazing sessions and speakers over last 2 years:

  1. Complete Agenda from Last year's ( Feb 2025) program : Explore last year's program
  2. YouTube Recordings of Next Generation EA Learning forum 2025
    1. Day 1 - Day 1 Next Gen EA Learning Forum 2025
    2. Day 2 - Day 2 Next Gen EA Learning Forum 2025
    3. Day 3 - Day 3 Next Gen EA Learning Forum 2025
  3. YouTube Recordings of Next Generation EA Learning Forum 2024
    1. Day 1 - Day 1 - Next Gen EA Forum 2024
    2. Day 3 - Day 3 - Next Gen EA Forum 2024

The 2026 forum will once again bring together real-world transformation insights, strategic foresight, and hands-on innovation from across the global Enterprise Architect community.  While the full agenda is currently in development, the program will explore key themes including:

  1. Thriving at the Edge of Human + Machine: clarity, leadership, and decision-making where human capability meets intelligent systems
  2. Architecture as a System, Discipline & Mindsets: operating models, clean core, toolchain, repeatability and mindsets
  3. Strategic Architecture Leadership & Architecture Practice: aligning business and IT for measurable value, long-term impact and establishing architecture practices.
  4. SAP Strategy, Technology & Roadmaps: connecting SAPâ€™s product strategy, platform direction, innovation roadmap, and architectural implications for customers.
  5. Real Life Transformation Journeys: lessons learned from SAP S/4HANA, RISE with SAP, and SAP BTP transformation programs.
  6. Data Inspired and Data Architecture: enabling business context, governance, and intelligent data design.
  7. AI-Driven & Agentic Architectures + AI Augmented Architect: unlocking new levels of insight, automation, adaptability, and real-world autonomous design patterns.
  8. The Future-Ready Architect + Life of an Enterprise Architect: how architects actually work, grow, adapt, and stay relevant â€” inside the reality of the role.
  9. Developing the Next Generation of Architects:  mentoring, pathways, and capability-building to grow future EA talent and multiply impact.
  10. The Human Edge: creativity, storytelling, influence, leadership, and the evolving role of the Enterprise Architect in the age of AI.
 

Once the registrations are open, you can secure your spot early and take advantage of special discounted rates for the Next Generation SAP Enterprise Architect Learning Forum 2026:

  • Super Early Bird â€“ Until December 19, 2025 â€“ $899
  • Early Bird â€“ Until January 30, 2026 â€“ $999
  • Standard Rate â€“ After February 7, 2026 â€“ $1,199

Your registration will include access to all main forum sessions, hands-on deep dives, networking events, and training materials.

Note: If you are interested in sponsoring the event or having a booth, please feel free to reach out to: ea-events@sap.com

Venue Details: SAP America Inc, Newtown Square, 3999 West Chester Pike, Newtown Square, PA 19073, USA

Add Event to you Calendar using this Link

entry.title: SAP TechEd on Tour Bangalore: Ignite innovation and expand your SAP network in the APAC region
entry.content:
Join us for SAP TechEd on Tour Bangalore, a leading event â€“ now for the first time in Bangalore â€“ tailored for developers, engineers, and technologists from global enterprises and partner ecosystems, taking place on November 25-26, 2025. If you're passionate about SAP technologies like SAP Business Suite, generative AI, SAP Build, or Joule, and are eager to turn your ideas into innovation with the support of a global community of peers and experts, then this is the event for you. Attendees will gain access to hands-on workshops, immersive demos, and direct engagement with SAP specialists to explore how these innovations can transform their business (session catalog).

Register today to secure your spot and be part of this transformative experience!

Why attend SAP TechEd on Tour Bangalore?

  • Unlock SAPâ€™s latest innovations: One of the highlights is the exploration of AI innovations and discovering the future of business intelligence, SAP Business Suite on SAP Business Technology Platform and SAP Business Data Cloud, and AI-driven solutions. The event is your gateway to understanding how AI can revolutionize your enterprise landscape.
  • Participate in hands-on workshops and certification bootcamps: SAP TechEd on Tour Bangalore offers a wide array of topics designed to broaden your technical expertise, validate your skills and to immerse yourself in scenarios that replicate everyday challenges. Nine talk tracks offer key topics highly relevant for SAP MaxAttention customers such as automation, business transformation management, cloud lifecycle management, digital transformation with cloud ERP, and innovations on the SAP Business Technology Platform. Take the opportunity to complete an SAP Certification exam on site for free (SAP Generative AI Developer or SAP Build Developer).
  • Expand your community, connect and collaborate: Engage with a network of developers in Community Talks to hear firsthand how organizations are addressing real-world business and IT challenges using SAPâ€™s latest technologies. Let conversation spark innovation by joining a global community of experts from the region.

At SAP TechEd on Tour Bangalore, you can hear more about the evolution of SAP MaxAttention, so join us at our SAP MaxAttention booth or sign up for Sebastien Denesâ€™ (Head of Global Premium Engagements Xperience) session.

Welcome to SAP TechEd on Tour Bangalore!

entry.title: KI-Agenten bei SAP: Ãœberblick, Beispiele, Umsetzung und Adoption mit Jochen Schneider
entry.content:
Stell Dir vor, du gibst deinem zehnjÃ¤hrigen Kind morgens die Anweisung: "In zehn Minuten fahren wir zur Schule." Was passiert? Im Idealfall zieht es sich selbststÃ¤ndig an â€“ Hose, Schuhe, Jacke â€“ und steht bereit. Genau so funktionieren KI-Agenten. Diese Metapher nutzt Jochen Schneider, verantwortlich fÃ¼r AI Capabilities auf der SAP Business Technology Platform, um zu erklÃ¤ren, was Agentic AI von herkÃ¶mmlichen Gen-AI-LÃ¶sungen unterscheidet. Im aktuellen EducationNewscast gibt er einen umfassenden Einblick in die Welt der KI-Agenten bei SAP â€“ von den Grundlagen Ã¼ber praktische Beispiele bis hin zu konkreten Tipps fÃ¼r den Einstieg.

Hier eine Zusammenfassung des fast einstÃ¼ndigen Interviews und GesprÃ¤ch - reinhÃ¶ren kÃ¶nnt ihr hier auf SAP-Podcasts - Apple - oder Spotify. Da das Thema so wichtig und spannend ist, denke ich, dass eine Zusammenfassung des Talks auch hier in der Gruppe von Interesse ist.

Was KI-Agenten wirklich ausmacht

Der Unterschied zwischen einem klassischen Chatbot oder Assistenten und einem KI-Agenten ist fundamental. WÃ¤hrend du bei ChatGPT einen Prompt eingibst und eine Antwort erhÃ¤ltst, arbeiten Agenten deutlich komplexer und autonomer. Jochen erklÃ¤rt das Prinzip anhand seiner Kinder: Du gibst nicht jeden einzelnen Schritt vor ("Zieh die Hose an, dann die Schuhe"), sondern beschreibst das gewÃ¼nschte Ergebnis. Der Agent findet dann selbst heraus, welche Schritte nÃ¶tig sind, um dieses Ziel zu erreichen.

Damit ein Agent funktioniert, braucht er drei zentrale Komponenten: Tools (die "HÃ¤nde", um Aktionen auszufÃ¼hren), Reasoning-FÃ¤higkeiten (den "Kopf", um Entscheidungen zu treffen) und Memory (das "GedÃ¤chtnis", um Kontext zu behalten und aus Erfahrungen zu lernen). Diese Kombination ermÃ¶glicht es Agenten, komplexe Aufgaben eigenstÃ¤ndig zu bewÃ¤ltigen, ohne dass du jeden Zwischenschritt vorgeben musst.

Ein wichtiger Punkt, den Jochen betont: Nicht alles sollte oder muss zum Agenten werden. Es gibt aktuell viel "Agent-Washing" â€“ Workflows, die als Agenten verkauft werden, obwohl sie deterministisch ablaufen. Seine Empfehlung ist klar: Wenn du einen Prozess mit einem klassischen Workflow abbilden kannst, solltest du das tun. Das ist kostengÃ¼nstiger und effizienter. Agenten zeigen ihre StÃ¤rke dort, wo Prozesse dynamisch, komplex und von Ã¤uÃŸeren Faktoren beeinflusst sind.

Wichtige Begriffe einfach erklÃ¤rt

Im Dialog mit Claude Ã¼ber den Podcast habe ich festgestellt, dass doch einige Fachbegriffe im Podcast vorkamen. Bevor wir in die Details eintauchen, hier die wichtigsten Fachbegriffe, die im Podcast und in dieser Zusammenfassung vorkommen â€“ verstÃ¤ndlich erklÃ¤rt. (War kein Teil des Podcasts, KI Experten kÃ¶nnen das einfach Ã¼berspringen).

Agentic AI / KI-Agenten Softwaresysteme, die eigenstÃ¤ndig Ziele verfolgen und dabei selbst entscheiden, welche Schritte nÃ¶tig sind. Anders als klassische Programme, die Schritt fÃ¼r Schritt Anweisungen befolgen, bekommen Agenten nur das Ziel vorgegeben und finden den Weg dorthin selbst. Wie ein Mitarbeiter, dem du sagst "Organisiere das Meeting", statt "Schreibe eine E-Mail an Person X, buche Raum Y, bestelle Catering Z".

Tokens Die "WÃ¤hrung" von KI-Modellen. Texte werden in kleine Einheiten (Tokens) zerlegt â€“ ungefÃ¤hr 4 Zeichen pro Token. Jede Anfrage an ein KI-Modell und jede Antwort kostet Tokens, und damit Geld. "Tokens verbrennen" bedeutet: unnÃ¶tig viele (teure) Anfragen an die KI stellen, z.B. wenn ein Agent in einer Endlosschleife hÃ¤ngt.

Deterministic vs. Non-Deterministic Deterministisch = vorhersagbar. Bei einem klassischen Workflow weiÃŸt du genau: Bei Input A kommt immer Output B raus. Non-deterministisch = nicht vorhersagbar. Ein Agent kann bei derselben Aufgabe verschiedene LÃ¶sungswege wÃ¤hlen â€“ wie ein Mensch, der kreativ an Probleme herangeht. Das macht Agenten flexibel, aber auch weniger kontrollierbar.

Reasoning Die FÃ¤higkeit eines KI-Modells, logisch zu denken, Schlussfolgerungen zu ziehen und Probleme zu lÃ¶sen. Statt nur Muster aus Trainingsdaten zu wiederholen, kÃ¶nnen moderne Reasoning-Modelle mehrschrittige Ãœberlegungen anstellen â€“ Ã¤hnlich wie du bei einer komplexen Entscheidung Pro und Contra abwÃ¤gst.

Tools (im Agent-Kontext) Die "Werkzeuge", die ein Agent nutzen kann, um Aufgaben zu erledigen. Das kÃ¶nnen APIs sein (um Daten abzurufen), Datenbanken (um Informationen zu suchen), oder Funktionen (um E-Mails zu versenden, KalendereintrÃ¤ge zu erstellen etc.). Ohne Tools ist ein Agent wie ein Handwerker ohne Werkzeugkasten â€“ er kann denken, aber nichts umsetzen. #HÃ¤nde ğŸ™‚

Memory (Short-Term & Long-Term) Das "GedÃ¤chtnis" eines Agenten. Short-Term Memory = er erinnert sich an die aktuelle Konversation ("Du hast vorhin gesagt, dass..."). Long-Term Memory = er speichert Informationen Ã¼ber lÃ¤ngere Zeit ("Letzten Monat hattest du nach X gefragt"). Ohne Memory mÃ¼sstest du einem Agenten jedes Mal alles neu erklÃ¤ren.

Human in the Loop Ein Kontrollmechanismus, bei dem ein Mensch an kritischen Punkten eingebunden wird, bevor der Agent eine Aktion ausfÃ¼hrt. Wie ein Vier-Augen-Prinzip: Der Agent schlÃ¤gt vor, der Mensch entscheidet. Besonders wichtig bei sensiblen Aufgaben oder am Anfang, wenn du dem Agenten noch nicht voll vertraust.

Und was man sieht: viele Inhalte der vergangene GesprÃ¤che im Podcast von KI Ethik, humanzetrierten Design oder KI Strategie sind auch im Kontext von Agenten zentral. BTW: Lernangebote speziell fÃ¼r den SAP AI Bereich haben hier im Blog gesammelt. 

Ich habe mich auf diesen Podcast mit Recherche und einem E-Learning von deeplearning.ai zu AgenticAI vorbereit. Der nÃ¤chste Schritt ist, dass ich mir eigene Agenten bastele. Mir fÃ¤llt es noch einfacher, Business Use Cases zu sehen anstatt fÃ¼r den persÃ¶nlichen Gebrauch - denn mir reichen oft GPTs oder eben das Nutzen von verschiedenen LLMs.

Oder wie seht Ihr das?

entry.title: SAP Datasphere News in October
entry.content:
SAP Datasphere News in October

Another month with a great new release delivery âœ¨

Learn more in my short top features video in October2025 on YouTube ğŸ“º also including an outlook at SAP TechEd session this year.

In addition, explore the latest updates in our community news blogs and more.

 

My top features in October

 

Impact of Changes in the Source Objects of an Analytic Model

Changing, saving, and re-deploying a data builder object again will trigger a status change of any analytic model that uses that object. The analytic model status will change to either â€œChanges to Deployâ€ or â€œDesign Time Errorâ€, depending on which change has been made (compatible or incompatible changes). This gives you better transparency in change control handling of your models.

 

Converting a Data Flow Into a Replication Flow and/or Transformation Flow

When your data flow is eligible to be converted into a transformation flow or a replication flow coupled with a transformation flow, a banner will be displayed in the data flow editor. Using a replication flow and/or a transformation flow will allow you to benefit from improved connectivity, access to delta load processing, and enhanced resiliency and scalability.
â¡ï¸   More information

 

Technical User to Manage Tasks via CLI

You can now use OAuth clients with the technical user purpose to manage tasks via the command line interface based on the roles and spaces you assign to the client.
â¡ï¸   More information.

 

 

 

SAP TechEd 2025

There are many sessions about SAP Business Data Cloud and also SAP Datasphere at SAP TechEd 2025. Some are part of the virtual TechEd and others like for instance the onsite hands-on sessions are exclusive for people attending in Berlin.

 

 

My favorite blogs in October

My colleague @Max_Gander wrote two nice blogs about the new feature with live versions in planning, which I think is a one of the best features I have seen all next to seamless planning itself:
â¡ï¸   Live Versions from an SQL Source for SAP Analytics Cloud Planning
â¡ï¸   Unlocking the Next Chapter of Seamless Planning in SAP Business Data Cloud with Live Versions

 

People Intelligence is one of the latest applications offered as part of SAP Business Data Cloud. @blberger has written a informative blog about its general availability and offers many useful links to further details about this offering:
â¡ï¸   Maximize the value of HR data â€“ Introducing People Intelligence
@VenkatPSis looking at the same topic from a use case perspective and explains the problems which can be solved using this application:
â¡ï¸   People Intelligence in SAP Business Data Cloud is Generally Available!

 

@hozumihighlight another interesting capability we recently delivered as part of SAP BDC, which is called BDC Connect and it helps expand the zero copy delta sharing to external systems: 
â¡ï¸   SAP BDC Connect: SAP elevates bidirectional zero-copy data sharing with game-changing partnerships

 

Keep on brining these valuable blogs @FernandaFroelich. On the one hand she extend her blog series on SAP Databricks by looking more detailed on user and roles with Databricks:
â¡ï¸   Get started with SAP Databricks: Users and roles
On the other hand, she helps you to better understand the consumption monitoring in SAP BDC:
â¡ï¸   How to monitor consumption for SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) and its components?

entry.title: Clean Core Extensibility: Balancing Standardization and Differentiation
entry.content:
Unlock Agility and Stability with a Clean Core

In todayâ€™s fast-paced digital landscape, organizations need both agility to innovate and stability to grow sustainably. The key to balancing these goals is a clean digital core â€” an ERP foundation that stays standardized, upgrade-stable, and ready for innovation.
But keeping your core clean doesnâ€™t mean giving up differentiation. It means being deliberate â€” extending only where it creates true business value and competitive advantage.
This is the essence of Clean Core Extensibility.

Clean Core Extensibility: Balancing Standardization and Differentiation

The SAP Business Suite brings this vision to life by unifying ERP and line-of-business applications on a common data foundation with embedded AI and SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) for extensibility. Together, these capabilities enable organizations to connect and optimize every function across the enterprise, ensuring that innovation remains upgrade-stable and grounded in reliable, trusted data.

SAPâ€™s clean core strategy is built on five guiding principles â€” Processes, Extensibility, Data, Integrations, and Operations. In this blog, we focus on the Extensibility principle, exploring how organizations can innovate safely and strategically while maintaining a standardized, upgrade-stable foundation.

The five guiding principles of a clean core

1. Why You Need a Clean Core â€“ and the New Extensibility Model

A clean core is the foundation of a modern cloud ERP strategy. It runs on standardized, upgrade-friendly configurations that minimize technical debt and maximize agility.

A clean core ensures:

  • Faster innovation through seamless cloud updates
  • Lower TCO and reduced complexity
  • Business agility through modular, composable extensions

While the clean core provides stability, extensibility defines how you tailor the system to your needs â€” without losing upgradeability. To enable innovation without sacrificing stability, SAP introduced an evolved Extensibility Model â€” separating standard ERP capabilities from custom innovations.

This cloud-first, modular approach allows extensions to live outside the core while connecting seamlessly to it.
It enables organizations to:

  • Build innovations safely on SAP BTP
  • Adopt continuous updates without disruption
  • Keep systems clean, stable, and flexible

The goal is simple: empower business differentiation while maintaining standardization at the core.

2. Strategic Extensibility in Practice: Extending and Applying the Model

Not all extensions add value â€” and not all differentiation requires custom code. True extensibility is strategic: focus on what drives growth, efficiency, or customer experience. Adopt best practices for core business processes, and customize only when it creates measurable advantage.

SAPâ€™s evolved Extensibility Model emphasizes decoupling extensions from the standard. By leveraging SAP Build, organizations can implement both on-stack (ABAP Cloud) and side-by-side (BTP) extensions, enabling key users and developers to innovate without modifying the SAP core. This approach ensures easier upgrades, better maintainability, and preserves upgrade stability.

Follow SAPâ€™s extensibility levels to maintain a clean core:

  1. Adopt a BTP-first mindset â€“ Use SAP Build on SAP BTP for custom logic, integrations, and innovation.
  2. Prefer Level A/B extensions: Level A - on-stack or side-by-side via released APIs, Level B - Making use of Classic APIs
  3. Use Level C (utilization of SAP-internal objects) only when absolutely necessary and apply the changelog.
  4. Avoid Level D and continuously refactor legacy code â€“ Move unused extensions out of the core.

This structured approach helps organizations balance standardization and differentiation, ensuring a clean core that is robust, adaptable, and ready for innovation.

Guidance for SAPâ€™s extensibility levels

3. Measuring Your Clean Core with RISE with SAP Methodology: The Clean Core Measurement Framework

Maintaining a clean core is an ongoing process. The Clean Core Measurement Framework helps organizations assess their governance and maturity, define target actions, and track progress through clean core KPIs.

The Governance and Maturity assessment evaluates the tooling, governance, and know-how required to get and stay clean. It calculates a current score for each clean core dimension and can be performed at any stage â€” before, during, or after transformation. Based on this, customers can define a target score aligned with their strategic goals. These criteria and assessments are fully embedded in the RISE with SAP Methodology.

Clean core KPIs complement this by measuring adherence during both implementation and operations. Derived from system data, these KPIs provide automated, transparent insights â€” fully visible in the RISE with SAP Methodology Dashboard.

Together, these measurements create visibility and accountability â€” helping organizations stay on track toward a truly clean core.

 4. How to Get Started

Begin your journey toward a Clean Core with Extensibility by reading our White Paper: Clean core extensibility White paper
It outlines a six-step path to achieving a clean core â€” from defining your strategy and analyzing custom code to adopting extension guidelines, establishing governance, and building upgrade-safe extensions.

And donâ€™t miss the video Achieving Clean Core with the Updated Clean Core Extensibility White Paper for an expert walkthrough of the key concepts and updates.

Start today â€” and turn your clean core into a foundation for continuous innovation.

 5. Customer Example: CAP Group â€“ Growth Through Clean Core

CAP Group modernized its ERP by moving custom logic to SAP BTP, achieving:

  • Simplified upgrades and operations
  • Faster innovation delivery
  • Improved scalability and flexibility

Their success shows that a clean core enables innovation and control to coexist â€” driving growth with less complexity. For more details, explore the CAP Group Clean Core Story on SAP.com.

Conclusion

A clean core isnâ€™t about avoiding customization â€” itâ€™s about making it count.
By standardizing your foundation, extending only where it drives advantage, and continuously measuring your progress, you build an ERP thatâ€™s agile, efficient, and future-ready.

Balance standardization for efficiency with extensibility for differentiation â€” thatâ€™s the essence of a clean core.

entry.title: Taking Control of Clean Core: When to Use Project Kernseife in addition to Standard SAP Tools
entry.content:
TL;DR

Measuring SAP Clean Core involves a choice:

  • As a RISE with SAP customer, you can benefit from the out-of-the-box standard approach with SAP Cloud ALM. The RISE with SAP Methodology Dashboard provides you with a high-level standardized view with minimal effort.
  • Or you can choose an open-source, highly flexible, and customizable approach with Project Kernseife. You get custom classification to create actionable insights, but it requires ownership and additional effort.

This article will help you decide which path is right for your team's Clean Core journey.

How the RISE with SAP Methodology Dashboard measures Clean Core

SAP's answer on how to measure clean core is based on two standard tools: The ABAP Test Cockpit (ATC) (and its newly released checks as from SAP Note 3565942) and the RISE with SAP Methodology Dashboard in SAP Cloud ALM.

The process begins with the ATC, which analyzes your custom code against a well-defined set of rules. The key to this analysis is the classification of your custom extensions based on the official release status of the standard SAP objects they utilize. This release information is transparently published by SAP in the Cloudification Repository (Viewer).

As described in more detail in the Clean Core Extensibility Whitepaper (see chapter 3.3), the ATC assigns your extension a level based on the most critical SAP object it utilizes:

  • Level A - For extensions using only stable, released objects, ensuring maximum upgrade security.
  • Level B - For extensions whose most critical dependency is a classic API like a BAPI or classic technical frameworks.
  • Level C - For extensions touching any unreleased, internal SAP objects.
  • Level D - For extensions using objects that are explicitly not recommended.

The results of this structured analysis can then be uploaded to SAP Cloud ALM, populating the Clean Core Extensibility KPIs in the RISE with SAP Methodology Dashboard. Recently, the dashboard was enhanced with a display of the Clean Core  Levels. This gives organizations a high-level, standardized view of their extensibility landscape, which is perfect for assessing their current situation and tracking progress. For the near future (Q1/2026) it is moreover planned to offer a deep dive dashboard that provides further details about the results.

What is "Project Kernseife"?

Project Kernseife is an open-source custom ATC Check for ABAP systems that enables you to flexibly score the usage of SAP objects in your system, e.g. to score the technical debt regarding clean core based on a custom, adjustable classification. More details on the parts and approach can be found in the blog "Project Kernseife - improving the measurement of Clean Core in ABAP".

Why Project Kernseife and its custom classification can be a Game-Changer for Clean Core Governance

Advantage 1: Fine-Tune SAP's Rules & Reduce "False Positives"

While SAP delivers thousands of released and classic APIs, it might still be not the perfect fit for your individual project and scope. Kernseife allows you to re-classify objects as "acceptable for your project", dramatically reducing noise and the need for mass ATC exemptions. Let's look into two different scenarios, to show you the benefits of custom classification:

Example 1: Stricter governance for direct table read

Within the standard classification, a direct read with a SELECT from any SAP table is considered as "Level C", which leads to warnings in ABAP Test Cockpit. In your project, you want to enforce the usage of ABAP cloud, you maybe have (see next point) identified many successor objects (custom and standard) and want to push developers to the successors objects (e.g., famous I_Product instead of MARA) by showing these as an error.
Remark: In standard ATC, you can adjust the priority of a check message in general (for example "Reading from DDIC database tables or DDIC table views is not recommended (successor available)", but not based on specific SAP objects you refer to.

Example 2: Need for usage of "internal object"

Now let's imagine you are working in a "clean core" project, but you need to extend processes around the Outbound Delivery Orders in EWM. After talking to experts, finding blog posts and even an "official" SAP Note, you identified the right interface: /SCWM/IF_API_WHR_OUTBOUND. Unfortunately, this is not yet listed as released or classic API. This would result in "warnings" in ATC and a classification as Level C ("Internal Objects" are used), although you did the best you can do. With Kernseife, you can now mark this SAP object as "recommended", which results in only "information" messages in ATC and leads to a "Level B" assessment of the custom code object / extension.

Based on these two examples, you can see: this is the power of a custom classification. You can overrule the SAP standard, be it because of timing (as you need the announced adjustments from the blog IMMEDIATELY) or scope (because SAP might not generally classify everything that you identify as "acceptable for your project" as "Classic API").

The possibility to "accept" usage of certain SAP objects will increase your governance quality, as your exemption approvers will not be flooded with hundreds of "false" exemption requests for objects that you generally accept in your project.

Advantage 2: Define and Enforce Custom Successors

While SAP is already delivering hundreds of the most important successor classifications (famous MARA -> I_Product), there might still be potential to guide your developers more precisely. Project Kernseife allows you to maintain a successor object in your classification, that will also be visible in the result of your ATC check - this makes it actionable for your developer!

 

Example 1: "Improve" Standard Successors

There are some more tables in the system, that have no successor mentioned officially, but where you can find (released!) CDS views as an alternative. To not flood you with details here, I simply refer to another blog based on the idea of @AndreasGraeber. But also for Function Modules or classes , there might be clear successors (e.g. not all READ_<table> might be having the successor information. There might be a lot of areas, where you want to decide in your project "don't use this, but use that!"

Example 2: Enforce and centralize Wrappers / custom successors

What happens if you create a wrapper for a standard SAP object, but your colleagues are not aware of it? They might re-create the same wrapper. With the possibility to also add Custom Objects (e.g. Z_WRAPPER_ABC) as a successor, you can also push your developers to harmonize the usage of wrappers.

Advantage 3: Enhance Dashboards for Measurement and Governance with consistent transparency

In several projects, we have already seen custom dashboards to track the current state of clean core. With the combination of the level concept and the "Technical Debt Score", you can assess systems and drill down into packages or even single objects.

Project Kernseife offers you direct access (e.g. with CDS-View ZKNSF_I_SCORING) to the data from ATC check runs to build these dashboards. You can use the Kernseife BTP Application to analyze your score - or create your own dashboard, for example with SAP Analytics Cloud, reflecting your custom rules to assign custom objects to business units (e.g. ZBR* is always Brasil).

The scoring is based on your configuration in the Kernseife classification, which allows you to own the definition of your clean core levels and deviate from SAP's standard definition - by this you own the definition of your clean core levels! To stick with the examples above, the usage of /SCWM/IF_API_WHR_OUTBOUND will impact your score in a limited way.

Advantage 4: Prioritize Your Cleanup Efforts with a "Potential Score"

After an analysis, you often face a daunting list of findings. The biggest challenge isnâ€™t just identifying the issues, but knowing where to start the cleanup. This is where Kernseife's scoring mechanism becomes a powerful prioritization engine by providing two key metrics for each finding: a Score and a Potential Score.

  • The Score reflects the technical debt of the object as it exists today, based on your custom rules.
  • The Potential Score shows what the score would be if the developer refactored the code to use the defined successor.

Let's use our familiar example:

  • Your classification assigns a high "Technical Debt" Score of 10 for a direct SELECT on table MARA.
  • The officially released successor, I_Product, has a "clean" score of 0. Therefore, the finding's Potential Score is 0.

This creates a clear, quantifiable "improvement gap." An object with a Score of 10 and a Potential Score of 0 is a high-impact cleanup opportunity. In contrast, a finding with a Score of 2 and no defined successor (meaning its Potential Score is also 2) is a lower priority for immediate refactoring.

By sorting your findings based on the largest gap between the Score and Potential Score, you can instantly identify the "low-hanging fruits" and the refactoring tasks with the biggest impact. Let's be clear, this is just one piece of information, and maybe you shouldn't have any custom code in this area based on a process analysis, but I still believe it is important to have data to drive your decisions - and Project Kernseife offers you data for the technical insights.

Making the Right Choice: A Balanced Look at Both Approaches

Key Reasons to Adopt Project Kernseife

The main reason to use a Project Kernseife is typically the power of the custom classification (as the last chapter pointed out). You can adjust the classification of SAP objects based on your project reality and support your clean core journey with tailored data.

In addition, there might be a temporary, tactical benefit: As of today, Kernseife's dashboards can fill a gap until SAP's "Extensibility Deep Dive" dashboard is generally available. 

Important Considerations: When the Standard Approach is a Better Fit

At the same time, I want to be very clear: Project Kernseife is not needed in every company and project.

  • 1. The Need for Standard Alignment: If your primary goal is to align perfectly with SAP's out-of-the-box reporting and dashboards without deviation, the standard approach is more appropriate.
  • 2. The Responsibility of Power: Custom classification is powerful, but it requires ownership. Someone must define, document, and maintain these custom rules. This is an ongoing responsibility (and effort!), which you can spare yourself when you go with the standard solution, i.e. RISE with SAP Methodology Dashboard.
  • 3. Implementation and Maintenance Overhead: While straightforward for experienced teams, implementing and maintaining any non-standard solution requires effort that must be planned for. It is ironically against the clean core imperative of leveraging "standard"!
  • 4. Unified Classification enables comparibility: Standardized classification leads to a comparability between different systems (e.g., you compare your central finance system with a peer system regarding the clean core level share), as the classification is the same for all systems.

Conclusion: Do you need to Take Control of Your Clean Core Strategy?

Project Kernseife is not for everyone. It is for organizations that find the standard clean core measurement too rigid and are ready to invest the effort to build a more nuanced, context-aware governance model. If you have the capacity and the architectural vision, it can transform your clean core initiative from a technical cleanup exercise into a strategic management of your system's extensibility.

Interested in more? Check out Project Kernseife: our open-source project where you can join the community, contribute, and support us with a GitHub star in the repository!

entry.title: The Joule Studio Learning Series: Lead Agentic Development with Confidence
entry.content:
Organizations are adopting agentic AI to transform how work gets done. Joule Studio offers developers a low code, no code environment to design and deploy secure, scalable, and interoperable Joule agents that plan and execute workflows in a heterogenous landscape. 

To help you get started, Iâ€™ve created a four-part enablement video series that walks you through everything: from understanding what Joule Studio is to building Joule agents. Whether youâ€™re just getting started or an experienced developer, this series will help you transform business workflows with the power agentic AI and Joule Studio. By the end of this enablement series, youâ€™ll have an understanding of: 

  • Joule Studio: its marketecture and capabilities   
  • Joule agents and skills: definition, characteristics, and use cases
  • How to build, test, and deploy your own Joule agents and skills

What is Joule Studio? 

Start your learning journey with an introduction to Joule Studio, underlying components, and how it enables the creation of adaptive, intelligent agents for business workflows.

Youâ€™ll learn: 

  • What Joule Studio is and what problems it solves 
  • Key capabilities and components 
  • The value Joule Studio delivers

 

 

What Are AI Agents and Joule Skills? 

Dive into the fundamentals. Understand the building blocks of Joule Studio: AI agents and Joule skills, how they work together, their characteristics, and use cases. 

Youâ€™ll learn: 

  • Difference between Joule skills and AI agents 
  • How AI agents work 
  • Common use cases for both 

 

Creating a Joule Skill in Joule Studio 

In this hands-on demo, learn how to create a Joule skill within SAP Build using Joule Studio for predictable execution of rule-based, repetitive tasks. The example walks through creating an ID badge in a third-party system after performing a preliminary check in SAP.  

Youâ€™ll learn: 

  • How to configure inputs and outputs for a Joule skill 
  • How to connect SAP and external systems 
  • How to configure messages to Joule 

 

Creating Joule Agents in Joule Studio 

See the agent builder capability in Joule Studio in action. This video shows how to create and configure a Joule agent end-to-end, equipping it with tools, models, and other configurations for adaptive execution in a business scenario. 

Youâ€™ll learn: 

  • How to create and test Joule agent 
  • How to configure tools, models, and skills 

 

Get Started with Joule Studio 

Ready to build your first agent? Check out additional documentation and resources to get started: 

  • How to get started with Joule Studio 
  • The Complete Joule Studio Resource Hub

entry.title: Build Business-Grounded AI Agents, Faster
entry.content:
At Sapphire 2025, SAP announced Joule Studio, a capability in SAP Build that enables developers to create Joule agents and skills. Deeply grounded in business data, these agents orchestrate workflows across heterogenous landscapes to deliver accurate outcomes. Joule Studio delivers an agent runtime with built-in data protection guardrails, multi-LLM support, and context retention across tasks for scalable, secure execution.  

Today, we are announcing additional capabilities that will equip developers with a comprehensive development tool kit to build scalable agentic AI for their business. We are introducing vibe coding experience to create not only conversational but also system-triggered AI agents. Instead of building from scratch, developers can also extend ready-to-use Joule agents as per their business needs. Joule Studio will also support open standards such as Model Context Protocol (MCP) and Agent2Agent (A2A) protocol. These advances empower developers to deliver end-to-end agentic automation with greater speed, flexibility, and control. See what our customers and partners from the beta program (Q3 2025) have to say: 

â€œWith Joule Studio, we could build powerful agents in three weeks. It is an intuitive, noâ€‘code environment that enables system connectivity across SAP and nonâ€‘SAP critical environments, for a hybrid landscapes where data resides in multiple modules.â€ 

 - Gianluca Simeone, VP - Global SAP CTIO and Gen-AI Leader at Capgemini 

â€œNestle, SAP, and IBM worked together on a supply chain Agentic AI PoC. With the agent builder capability in Joule Studio, we created this POC bringing in data from SAP and non-SAP sources to create an agent that will automate our complex Order fulfillment processesâ€  

- Pablo Nill, Sr Product Group Manager, Nestle  

 â€œWith Joule Studio, agentic innovation moves closer to the heart of operations. At KPMG, weâ€™re helping to shape trusted solutions that transform business context into measurable value by building specialized AI agents for fulfillment orchestration, supply chain management, and moreâ€. 

 - Valentino KÃ¶ster, Global Head of SAP360 Program & AI, KPMG AG WPG, Germany 

Fastâ€‘Tracking Ideas into Agents: Empowering Developers with AI 

To lower the barrier to AI adoption, Joule Studio provides AI assistance in the design-time experience of creating agents. Developers can use natural language to share their requirements with Joule copilot and get contextual recommendations for agent definition, tools, and other configurations, tailored to their specific needs. For example, Joule may suggest and add relevant Joule skills to custom Joule agents. This makes agent creation more accessible and accelerates time-to-value. 

Image 1: AI-assistance in Joule Studio

Cross-Ecosystem Integration with Model Context Protocol (MCP) 

One of the most significant updates is Joule Studioâ€™s support for MCP, an open standard that provides a unified way to connect AI agents with external systems. This breaks down traditional application silos and enables cross-platform agent execution. In Joule Studio, you can configure connectivity to external MCP servers, allowing agents to use third-party tools and applications. For example, a support agent that you built in Joule Studio can retrieve ticket information from a third-party IT service platform exposed via MCP. This open integration empowers AI agents to act as central, intelligent orchestrators, managing complex workflows across diverse systems without the need for custom integrations.  

Image 2: Configuration of tools, MCP servers, and models for agent design

Proactive Agentic Automation with System-Triggered Agents 

Joule Studio will support the creation of system-triggered AI agents that operate autonomously with no human input. Triggers such as business events, APIs, and schedules will be supported for agents to be initiated. This elevates agents from being reactive to proactive collaborators, capable of initiating actions like inventory monitoring and initiating purchase orders for low stock items or incident response. That enables true end-to-end automation of business processes with minimal human intervention.  

Image 3: Add triggers for custom agents

Adapt Pre-Built, SAP-Delivered Agents to Your Enterprise  

In Joule Studio, developers will be able to extend ready-to-use Joule agents by adding additional tools and custom skills as pre- and post-processing steps. For example, extend an Accounts Receivable Agent, which analyzes overdue receivables and follows up with customers, by grounding it in your order handling policy for informed decision making. This allows you to tailor ready-to-use Joule agents to your unique business requirements.

Image 4: Extending ready-to-use Joule agents 

Getting Started with agent builder in Joule Studio

The agent builder will be generally available in December 2025 with support for MCP, agent as a tool, vibe coding, and document grounding part of first release. Later in 2026, we will release support for agent extensibility, system-triggered agents, A2A, and agent observability. 

If you are interested in learning more:

  • Register for the webinar for a closer look at agent builder experience: Link
  • Visit the Joule Studio webpage: Link
  • Checkout demo on building Joule agents in Joule Studio: Demo

entry.title: Pioneer AI Innovation: SAP Customer Engagement Initiative Registration Open Until Nov 14, 2025
entry.content:
Are you prepared to unlock AIâ€™s full potential and revolutionize your industry? With SAPâ€™s advanced AI technology, you can optimize operations, enhance decision-making, and boost efficiency like never before.

Now's your chance to go beyond adoption - and become a pioneer of innovation. By participating in our SAP Customer Engagement Initiative projects, youâ€™ll actively shape the next generation of AI solutions. Your input wonâ€™t just be considered: it will directly influence the design of smarter tools tailored to your real-world needs.

Donâ€™t miss this chance to lead the digital transformation with AI - Registration is open only until November 14, 2025.

Check out the full list here or follow the links below to discover the exciting opportunities:

SAP Business Technology Platform

  • AI-assisted message monitoring agent for SAP Integration Suite
  • The impact of AI on SAP BTP users

Data & Analytics

  • AI- Assisted Summaries in SAP Analytics Cloud Stories

SAP S/4HANA Cloud

Digital Supply Chain Cloud

  • Identify un-assessed assets and auto propose draft risk assessments using AI Agent

Public Cloud

  • AI Agent for Accrual Postings SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • AI Agent for Debt Collection
  • AI Assistant for Manual Postings in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • Business AI for Product Cost Controlling
  • Joule as Project Assistant: Optimizing Project Execution and Reducing Manual Processes
  • Letâ€™s Create the Future of US Sales and Use Tax with AI
  • SAP Risk and Assurance Management - Exploring Joule use cases and AI features

Lifecycle Management

  • Automation and AI in Private Cloud Workspace

Letâ€™s build the future together!

Innovation thrives through collaboration. By participating in the SAP Customer Engagement Initiative projects, you help SAP develop more effective and relevant solutions for businesses like yours. This is your chance to impact the future of enterprise technology.

Donâ€™t miss out - sign up today at influence.sap.com and be a part of the SAP Customer Engagement Initiative Cycle 3 in 2025!

Warm regards,

Your SAP Customer Engagement Initiative Team

Follow-up after registration: When you register for a project, you will be invited to an introductory call with the SAP project lead. Participation beyond this point is optional and typically governed by the Feedback Agreement with SAP.
